ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: developed my knowledge of hip hop music and how it has influenced so much of our world. i didn't know hip hop included things such as graffiti and breakdancing, so it was really interesting to learn this and make these connections. also learned so much about the production of music that now causes me to think more deeply about the way songs are created. I was also enlightened on the beauties of so many different styles of music and artists I did not know about before. loved this course!

I developed a deeper appreciation for hip-hop music, graffiti, and other elements of hip-hop culture in the past and present, not only from our conversations as a class but also from actual artists who joined our discussions.

Learned so much about early hip-hop, along with documentaries that focus on all aspects of hip-hop, whether that be b-boys, djing, rapping, etc. Class becomes a community quickly with focus on technical aspects of hip-hop along with just checking in on how students are actually feeling and what theyre listening to

We learned about the rich culture and historical origins of hip hop in its different manifestations, including music, dance, and art. Watched plenty of documentaries and listened to a lot of cool music. The final project was a creative project, which was a nice change of pace from the traditional paper (people made art, podcasts, etc.).

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: amazing! Nick is awesome and created such a wonderful environment for us all, even over zoom! really powerful course instrumental to my growth and understanding of pop culture

Strengths: Professor Conway is incredibly supportive, encouraging, and just wants us to enjoy learning! So much of the class experience is about building a community. We all got to know each other and support each other through this difficult semester and it was really a highlight for me. Weaknesses: It might be nice if Professor Conway posted the suggested songs and film for the week on Canvas because most of the communication happened through our class's GroupMe and sometimes I couldn't find what we were supposed to have watched/listened to for the week.
No weaknesses, strengths are that Nick is the best teacher Ive ever had, so understanding, helps everyone get close, music video competitions, and everyone gets to show a creative side
Perfect course.

The strength of the class rests on the engagement of the students, I think. It was easy to take a backseat, and you really get out of the class what you put into it. Nick is a great discussion leader and genuinely takes interest in his students, which makes class an absolute joy, even though it was on Friday afternoons.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: best class I've taken over zoom and at Yale in general!
Just upsetting that we couldnt be in person for live performances, but Nick elevated it by bringing in some of his guests (some legendary rappers included) to increase our engagement
n/a

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely, Nick is an incredible, understandable, and knowledgeable professor. Take the class, not just for the content, but the people in it! One of the best college seminars I've taken.

YES PLEASE TAKE IT! EVERYONE SHOULD TAKE THIS CLASS! the workload is low but you literally learn sooooo much and are part of such a wonderful atmosphere with Nick and classmates. this is the best class I've taken at Yale and I'd take it again if I could!
Yes, absolutely take this class if you love hip-hop music, or if you think you might grow to love it!
Yes actually the best class Ive ever taken at Yale by far
Absolutely, it was the perfect introduction to Hip Hop as a cultural movement and art form.

If you're interested in hip hop, you have to take this class. If you're not super into it, you might miss a lot of 'obvious' references, but even then, you'll come out of it learning so much (and getting put on so much music!).

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: GroupMe chat along with the live virtual lectures
A lot of documentary-watching and music-listening.
